message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SI 

The paper discusses the learning process of neural networks, which is a central topic in machine learning. The use of topological data analysis to study the emergence of structure in the weights suggests a focus on the mathematical and theoretical aspects of the problem, which is typical of the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The use of the MNIST dataset and the study of the growth of the effective capacity of each layer suggest a focus on neural networks and their architecture, which is typical of the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. The fact that the networks are used for image classification suggests a focus on computer vision, which is typical of the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. The study of the natural coordinates on the learning surfaces suggests a focus on the interpretation and visualization of the results, which is typical of the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. Finally, the fact that the paper is published in arXiv suggests a focus on the dissemination of research in computer science, which is typical of the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-category.
